meanings.definition: guarders: a person or group of people responsible for protecting or watching over something
meanings.sent1: The guarders at the museum made sure no one touched the valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The guarders patrolled the neighborhood to keep everyone safe.
meanings.sent3: The guarders at the zoo had to keep a close eye on the mischievous monkeys.
meanings.sent4: The guarders of the forest stood tall like ancient trees, protecting the wildlife within.
meanings.sent5: The guarders were like silent shadows, always vigilant and ready to act.

meanings.definition: guarders: devices or mechanisms used to protect or secure something
meanings.sent1: The security cameras were the guarders of the warehouse, monitoring every corner.
meanings.sent2: The guarders on the gate beeped as visitors passed through, ensuring safety.
meanings.sent3: The guarders on the treasure chest were tricky to bypass, but the pirate managed to open it.
meanings.sent4: The lock and key were the guarders of the secret diary, keeping its contents safe.
meanings.sent5: The guarders on the safe clicked open, revealing the precious jewels inside.
